resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.
Sum of water that flows out from subsurface layer(s) including the groundwater layer (if present). Equals qg in case of a groundwater layer below only one soil layer.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Water that percolates through the soil layer(s) into the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.
Water that leaves the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: River discharge or streamflow. Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: As evap, but with all resistances set to zero, except the aerodynamic resistance.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

long_name: Soil Moisture Content at Root Zone

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Total simulated soil moisture available for evapotranspiration. Please indicate the depth of the root zone for each vegetation type in your model. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m.

Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". This is the most important variable for the permafrost sector. If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
Grid cell mean depth of snowpack. This variable only for the purposes of the permafrost sector.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen) averaged over grid cell. Please also deliver for the permafrost sector.
Mean monthly water storage in all compartments. Please indicate in the netcdf metadata which storage compartments are considered.
Mean monthly water storage in the canopy.
Mean monthly water storage in glaciers.
Mean monthly water storage in groundwater layer.
Mean monthly water storage in lakes (except reservoirs).
Mean monthly water storage in wetlands.
Mean monthly water storage in rivers.
Mean monthly water storage in reservoirs.
Calculated from daily thaw depths.
Mean monthly water temperature in river (representative of the average temperature across the channel volume).

long_name: Potential Irrigation Water Withdrawal (assuming unlimited water supply)

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Irrigation water withdrawn in case of optimal irrigation (in addition to rainfall).

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Irrigation water withdrawal, taking water availability into account; please provide if computed.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, assuming unlimited water supply.
Soil water demand required to avoid water stress, excluding any water losses associate with application or transport.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, taking water availability into account; if computed.

long_name: Actual Irrigation Green Water Consumption on Irrigated Cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed.

long_name: Potential Irrigation Green Water Consumption on Irrigated Cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Potential evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed and different from AIrrUseGreen.

long_name: Actual Green Water Consumption on Rainfed Cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over rainfed cropland; if computed.

Sum of actual consumptive water use from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.
Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) water withdrawal from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.
Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) consumptive water use from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.
If computed. There is no need to submit ainduse if its components are being submitted separately (ainduse = amanuse + aelecuse).
If computed. There is no need to submit aindww if its components are being submitted separately (aindww = amanww + aelecww).
If computed. There is no need to submit pinduse if its components are being submitted separately (pinduse = pmanuse + pelecuse).
If computed. There is no need to submit pindww if its components are being submitted separately (pindww = pmanww + pelecww).

Soil types or texture classes as used by your model. Please include a description of each type or class, especially if these are different from the standard HSWD and GSWP3 soil types. Please also include a description of the parameters and values associated with these soil types (parameter values could be submitted as spatial fields where appropriate).

units: dry matter (t ha-1 per growing season)
comment: Crop-specific: Yield may be identical to above-ground biomass (biom) if the entire plant is harvested, e.g. for bioenergy production.
Portion of all water (including rain) that is evapo-transpired, the water amount should be accumulated over the entire growing period (not the calendar year)
Total nitrogen application rate. If organic and inorganic amendments are applied, rate should be reported as effective inorganic nitrogen input (ignoring residues).
Julian dates.
This allows for clear identification of planting that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project
Together with the year of anthesis added to the list of outputs (see below) it allows for clear identification of anthesis that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.
It allows for clear identification of anthesis that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.
Together with the year of maturity added to the list of outputs (see below) it allows for clear identification of maturity that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.
It allows for clear identification of maturity that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

Ideally should be modeled with realistic land-use history and initial carbon pools. Subject to extra study.
Ideally should be modeled with realistic land-use history and initial carbon pools. Subject to extra study.

comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻². Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻²Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Vegetation Biomass

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻². Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Species information is essential. Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool

comment.biomes: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. Species information is essential.
comment.fire: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.fire: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation.  If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.forestry: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and species information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.permafrost: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.

long_name: Carbon in Products of Land Use Change

comment.biomes: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.
comment.fire: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.
comment.forestry: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.

comment.biomes: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time of the given day/month/year (for daily/monthly/annual resolution)
comment.permafrost: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time of the given day/month/year (for daily/monthly/annual resolution)

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.

long_name: CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change
comment: For wood products only. Sum of CO₂ fluxes to wood production and wood storage turnover emsissions from previous years.

long_name: CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Grazing
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Crop Harvesting
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation to Litter
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
comment: Carbon going  directly into the soil pool without entering litter (e.g., root exudate). Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation
comment: Value between 0 and 100. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land. For models that have grid cells partially covered by land and ocean, please document this in the model documentation and provide your land-sea mask along the data uploads.
The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).
Includes sublimation.
Including sapwood and hardwood.
Including fine and coarse roots.

long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Lake-Atmosphere Interface
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. the residual term of the surface energy balance, i.e. the net amount of energy that enters the lake on daily time scale: lakeheatf = swdown - swup + lwdown - lwup - sensheatf - latenheatf (terms defined positive when directed upwards)

resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Only if computed by the model.

resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

Albedo of the land surface interacting with the atmosphere. Average of pfts, snow cover, bare ground.

resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

long_name: Number of Deaths Attributable to Cold
comment: For ERF models, this occurs when temperature is below threshold (e.g., minimum mortality temperature (MMT)). Report 0 if temperature above threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

long_name: Number of Deaths Attributable to Heat
comment: Temperature above threshold (ERFs). Report 0 if temperature below threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

To be reported as annual series of mean daily total mortality, or as a single number of mean daily mortality; to be used for computations of attributable fractions. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
Baseline population data should be provided for computations of mortality rates (i.e. deaths per total population). See Section ‎5.1.6. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change
comment: Deforestation fires
Should not be part of ffire

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change
comment: C emitted from deforestation fires (if simulated).
If calculated, weighted by burned area. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
as appropriate for your model

long_name: Combustion Completeness of Different Fuel Classes
comment: (between 0 and 1), fraction of fuel combusted in a fire

long_name: Fuel Moisture for Different Fuel Classes
comment: as a fraction of fuel dry mass (not percentage)
95th percentile of number of fires in one day during the month
fraction of area covered by trees
Monthly mean weighted with the number of fires of each day
95th percentile of fire size computed during the month
Mean needs to be weighted with the number of fires

long_name: Weighted Mean Fire Rate of Spread
comment: Mean needs to be weighted with burned area
mean height of canopy formed by trees over 5m.  Vegetation of less than 5m should be excluded from the canopy height calculation (i.e. not contributing with zero)
fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation less than 5 m tall
fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation more than 5 m tall
The total area associated with each grid cell in the model.

The fraction of each grid cell that is assumed to be continent, i.e., not ocean. Should be 0 if the entire cell is assumed to be ocean, 1 if the entire cell is assumed to be covered by land or inland water bodies.
